title.narrative: A.1.2 Establishment of a joint task force of experts for energy efficiency in buildings
A.1.2 Establishment of a joint task force of experts for energy efficiency in buildings

target.value: A.1.2 Establishment of a joint task force of experts for energy efficiency in buildings

actual.value: Activities done: • Approaching member States and other relevant stakeholders to ask for nominations to join the Joint Task Force • Establishment of a list of experts who are part of the Joint Task Force Both activities are not a variation from the project document In April 2015. the UNECE organized the Expert Consultation on Energy-Efficiency Standards in Buildings. During this event. the participants recommended to establish a Joint Task Force on Energy Efficiency Standards in Buildings with the aim to promote energy efficiency in the UNECE region and carry out some activities for this purpose. In 2016 the joint Task Force was established by the Committee on Housing and Land Management and the Committee on Sustainable Energy and includes government officials. international organizations and other relevant stakeholders’ representatives. The activity is completed.

title.narrative: A1.3. Development of best practices for existing standards and technologies
A1.3. Development of best practices for existing standards and technologies

target.value: A1.3. Development of best practices for existing standards and technologies

actual.value: Activities done: • Elaboration of the study “Compendium of best practices on standards and technologies for energy efficiency in buildings in the UNECE region” – this is not a variation from the project document Another activity carried out by the Joint Task Force was the development of a “Compendium of best practices on standards and technologies for energy efficiency in buildings in the UNECE region”. It had the purpose to identify best practices on adopting. implementing and enforcing energy efficiency standards and energy efficiency technologies for the building sector in the UNECE region and prepare a collection of best practices. The study was undertaken from November 2018 to January 2019. The activity is completed. The Compendium is attached with the report and will be published as an official publication.

title.narrative: A.1.1 Undertake mapping of energy efficiency standards and technologies in buildings in the UNECE region
A.1.1 Undertake mapping of energy efficiency standards and technologies in buildings in the UNECE region

target.value: A.1.1 Undertake mapping of energy efficiency standards and technologies in buildings in the UNECE region

actual.value: Activities done: • Elaboration of the study “Mapping of energy efficiency standards and technologies in buildings in the UNECE region” The study was developed in the period of November 2017-June 2018. The study was prepared based on outcomes of a survey of member States conducted from November to February 2018. The draft study was reviewed by members if the Joint Task Force and validated during the event “Workshop on Validation of Results of Mapping of Energy Efficiency Standards in Buildings in the UNECE Region - Second Meeting of the Joint Task Force on Energy Efficiency Standards in Buildings” on 14-15 April. Yerevan. Armenia. The activity is completed. The report is on http://www.unece.org/index.php?id=50688

title.narrative: A.1.4. Organizing one meeting of the joint task force of experts for energy efficiency in building
A.1.4. Organizing one meeting of the joint task force of experts for energy efficiency in building

target.value: A.1.4. Organizing one meeting of the joint task force of experts for energy efficiency in building

actual.value: Activities done: • Organization of the First meeting of the Joint Task Force on Energy Efficiency Standards in Buildings on 30 - 31 October 2017 in Geneva – this is not a variation from the project document After the establishment of the Joint Task Force. the UNECE organized the First meeting of the Joint Task Force on Energy Efficiency Standards in Buildings on 30 - 31 October 2017 in Geneva. The event’s objectives are to operationalize the Task Force and to discuss the approaches and preliminary results of a study on mapping existing energy efficiency standards in buildings in the UNECE region. The Joint Task Force will also discuss and agree on the proposed activities to carry out until 31 December 2018. The activity is completed.

title.narrative: Improved knowledge of ECE MS about energy efficiency standards in building in the UNECE region
